function_reachability: Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i <= n' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i <= n' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'i < n' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < n' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i <= n' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < n' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'n (line 4)' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'numbers (line 4)' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'primes' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'numbers' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Can the program actually reach the statement: “numbers[i] = 0;”?
